result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon T. VICE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.   
Count 2 - Possess heroin with intent to deliver - Guilty plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1, 3, 4, & 5.   Motion granted.   Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.   Report to be filed by 01-31-17.   Sentencing hearing is set for 02-07-17 at 11:00 a.m.   Court orders defendant's bail revoked.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with DA set for 09-25-15 at 2:15 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.
Matthew Kolell, through public defender.

Order to Withdraw.
Whereas, Attoreny Pangburn requested to withdraw due to a conflict of interest; the Court now orders:
1. That Attorney Pangburn be allowed to withdraw as counsel of record.
2. That Attorney Pangburn immediately notify the Publc Defender's Office that a new attorney will need to be appointed for Mr. Vice.
3. That the preliminary hearing be adjourned to September 2, 2015, at 1:30 p.m.
Cover letter.

Defendant in custody.
Attorney Pangburn has discovered a conflict and cannot represent the defendant on this matter.  He moves to withdraw.
The Court grants the motion.  Attorney Pangburn to draft the appropriate order.
The defendant refuses to waive time limits.
The Court finds good cause to extend the time limits without the defendant's cooperation.
Preliminary hearing is set for 09-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Motion to Modify Bail.
Cover letter.

Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection;
Cover Letter.
Eric Pangburn, through public defender.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-26-15 at 1:30 p.m.
RE:  Tammy Vice, on 08-08-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of operate without owner's consent, 3 counts felony bail jumping, 7 counts misdemeanor bail jumping and possess heroin with intent to deliver.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-17-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department  for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
